tool.name: Run PACT
tool.description: Analyze Argo Navis BEAST run using PACT

param.name: posterior_trees
param.label: BEAST trees
param.help: This is the Posterior Trees output from Argo Navis BEAST. If pulling in from an external BEAST run, make sure to pull in the tree file with 'traits'.

param.name: custom_pact_settings
param.label: Custom PACT spec
param.help: Not required. You can specify a custom PACT file if you would like to perform some custom anlayses. If you do, results will be place in the 'Raw output' folder/archive.

param.name: tip_selection_method
param.label: Tip Selection Method
param.help: You may optionally choose to restrict these PACT analyses to a subset of the sequences. By default, all tips are included in the analysis, but this can be switched.

param.name: deme_subset
param.label: Deme
param.help: Restrict analyses to the specified deme

param.name: tip_name_subset
param.label: Tip names
param.help: Restrict analyses to the specified tip names

param.name: tip_name_subset_file
param.label: Tip names file
param.help: A file with one tip name per line

param.name: colorbrewer_pallet
param.label: Deme and optionally date information
param.help: A valid colorbrewer2 color scheme name. See http://colorbrewer2.org/ for details.

param.name: color_spec_file
param.label: Color spec file
param.help: This should be a CSV file with 'deme' and 'color' columns, specifying what color each deme should be associated wtih

param.name: time_range_specification_method
param.label: Time range
param.option: Time to MRCA of selected tips

param.name: time_range_start
param.label: Start time
param.help: The age of the oldest ancestry which should be considered (as a positive number)

param.name: time_range_end
param.label: End time
param.help: The age of the most recent ancestry which should be considered (as a non-negative number)

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
What it does ------------
This runs PACT for an Argo Navis analysis. PACT (Posterior Analysis of Coalescent Trees), as the name suggests, is a tool for analyzing the tree file output of an Argo Navis BEAST run. It is an impressive tool, with many powerful analytic features, but we'll only focus on a core subset in this wrapper of the tool.
The key features of PACT that make it so powerful are its vast range of statistics and metrics which can be computed, coupled with it's ability to restrict these metrics to a subset of the tree ancestry, both in time and in tree tips. These features make it possible to ask very pointed questions out of a complicated data set. For instance, imagine you have virus sequences from a number of host species; You might want to find out what the ancestry looks like of the viruses in species A. In particular, you might want to know what population(s) the virus in species A was in just before ending there. With PACT, you can simply subset to the viruses in species A to invetigate this, and look at any number of statistics for them.
While PACT has many different analyses and statistics you can perform, here we focus on a select few. We look at:
* **Skyline proportions**: These look at the ancestral proportions associated with each deme as we look back towards the root. * **Migrate rates**: These are estimates with bounds of the rate of migration between each pair of demes. * **Maximum likelyhood reconstruction**: The most likley tree and acestral demestate history in the posterior. * **Other miscelaneous stats**: TMCA, etc.
We also let you restrict the tree to any tip set or temporal range you like.
If you would like to run other analyses, you can take a look at the `PACT documentation`_. While this tool doesn't support plotting functionality for more advanced analyses, you can place your own PACT file in this tool, get the results in the output zip file and do what you like with them.
Output files ------------
This tool outputs two files:
* **PACT figures**: A collection of figures representing the results for these analyses. * **All files**: A collection of any other files output by PACT.
.. _PACT documentation: https://github.com/trvrb/PACT/blob/master/pact_manual.pdf?raw=true
